intro: Collomia grandiflora f. diffusa, commonly known as the Sierra starflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, such as meadows and slopes. Its flowers are showy and bloom in late spring to early summer. The subspecies 'diffusa' is distinguished by its more diffuse growth habit compared to the typical form.
